name: Gitleaks
description: Scan git repos (or files) for secrets using regex and entropy.
author: Joost Voskuil (joost@foxhole.nl)

inputs.name: scanlocation
inputs.label: Scan Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the location to scan. Defaults to your sources directory.

inputs.name: configtype
inputs.label: Configuration Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify if you want to use the default, predefined config or a custom config.

inputs.name: scanmode
inputs.label: Scan range
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the mode of what the scope is of the commits to be scanned.

inputs.name: redact
inputs.label: Redact
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want to redact secrets from log messages and leaks.

inputs.name: taskfail
inputs.label: Fail the task if secrets are found.

inputs.name: uploadresults
inputs.label: Upload results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want to upload the results as an artifact.

inputs.name: reportformat
inputs.label: Report format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a report format: json, sarif, csv (default: sarif)

inputs.name: reportname
inputs.label: Custom Report Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the filename of the report without the extension.

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.label: Verbose output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want gitleaks to print verbose output.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Gitleaks version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the version of Gitleaks to use. Must be minimal major version 8. Use 'latest' for latest version.

inputs.name: customtoollocation
inputs.label: Gitleaks custom tool location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the custom directory of Gitleaks, when provided, Gitleaks will not be downloaded.

inputs.name: taskfailonexecutionerror
inputs.label: Fail the task if this task produces an error (including download errors).
